labels.text: Inspired by Wong Kar-wai’s film In the Mood for Love (2000), Angkor Quartet depicts a fictional musical foursome with the film’s two lead characters, played by Maggie Cheung and Tony Leung, on guitar at the centre, flanked by singer Rebecca Pan on drums and Wong Karwai on xylophone. They are shown playing the film’s theme song, ‘Quizas, Quizas, Quizas’. Set in 1962 and steeped in nostalgia, Wong’s film captures a period in Hong Kong’s past when the city acted as a crucial hub for trade with and migration to Southeast Asia, and when places such as Singapore and Cambodia seemed to be not far-off locales but fluid extensions of the territory. Shieh’s addition of the Hôtel d’Angkor insignia underscores this relationship and makes reference to the final scene of In the Mood for Love, filmed outside Hong Kong, at Angkor Wat, Cambodia.

labels.text: 《 吳哥大樂隊》取材自王家衛的電影《 花樣年 華》( 2000 年) ，在這虛構樂隊的四位成員中，兩 位結他手即電影中張曼玉和梁朝偉所演的主角，鼓 手和木琴手則分別為歌星潘迪華和導演王家衛。 畫中四人正在合奏電影主題曲《 Quizas, Quizas, Quizas》。 電影以 1962 年作為時代背景，洋溢懷舊 氣息。當年香港是東南亞移民及貿易互通的樞紐， 而新加坡和柬埔寨等地並非看似遙遠異邦，東南亞 順理成章成為香港向外伸延的地域。石家豪在作 品中加入「 吳哥酒店」， 既標誌了這些地域關係， 也呼應電影在柬埔寨吳哥窟取景的最後一幕。

images.AltText: The painting shows a man and woman playing guitar and bass on top of an insignia on the floor that says ‘Hotel d’Angkor’. The words ‘Tony Leung guitar’ are written next to the man, and the words ‘Maggie Cheung bass’ and ‘Quizas’ are written next to the woman.
images.AltTextTC: 畫作裏，一個男人和一個女人分別在彈奏結他和低音結他，地面的徽章標示着「吳哥酒店」。男人身旁用英文寫着「梁朝偉」、「結他」，女人身旁則用英文寫着「張曼玉」、「低音結他」和西班牙文單詞「或許」。

images.AltText: Ink and colour painting on silk of a woman standing in front of three drums and playing them with her hands. The words ‘Rebecca Pan, congas’ and ‘Quizas’ are written next to her.
images.AltTextTC: 水墨設色絹本繪畫，畫中一名女子站在三個鼓後用雙手打鼓。女子身旁以英文寫着潘迪華的洋名「Rebecca Pan」、「康加鼓」和意思為「或許」的西班牙文「Quizas」。
